original: lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //

original: ; dad pa tshul khrims thos pa /
analyzed: ; dad pa tshul khrims thos pa /

translated: Faith in the Three Jewels, morality which is the avoidance of that which is naturally unwholesome and unwholesome by prescription, learning which is the understanding of the Vinaya and so forth,

analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / de shes pa mthong ba rnams so zhes pa ni /

analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di lnga lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //

original: de la tshul khrims zhes pa ni 'dul ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims zhes pa ni 'dul ba shes pa'o //

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //

original: shes rab ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra /
analyzed: shes rab ni gong du bshad pa dang 'dra /

analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni mi slob pa'i rnam par grol ba'o //

original: de shes pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //

original: mthong zhes pa ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o ;
analyzed: mthong zhes pa ni mi slob pa'i lta ba'o ;

original: ; brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang shes rab dang ldan bar sbyor ba yang ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ; brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang shes rab dang ldan bar sbyor ba yang ngo zhes pa ni /

analyzed: 'og ma'i mdo gsum dang sbyor bar ston pa'o //

analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni dran pa dang ldan ba'i steng du /

analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa dang / gong ma gnyis kyis bsnan te lnga lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
translated: On top of that, one who has begun striving, is endowed with wisdom, and is endowed with the two above is shown to be one group of five.

analyzed: dben pa yang ngo zhes pa ni 'du 'ji med pa ste / 'di'i steng du gong ma bzhis bsnan te /

analyzed: phrugs gcig tu ston pa snga ma dang 'dra'o /
translated: On top of that, one who is endowed with the four above is shown to be one group of five, just as before.

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa ni sems mi g-yeng bar khugs shing zhi pa nyid de /

analyzed: 'di yang gong ma dang 'dra bar lnga phrugs gcig tu ston to //

analyzed: slob pa yang ngo zhes pa ni zag pa med pa'i lam gyis nyen mongs pa spong bar slob pas na slob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase and also a learner means that one is a learner because one is training in abandoning the afflictions through the uncontaminated path.

analyzed: slob pa'i tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / de shes pa mthong ba'i phung po rnams dang ldan pa /
translated: One possesses the aggregates of ethics, meditative stabilization, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation of a learner.

original: @12a * // lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: @12a * // lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //
translated: This is shown to be a single pentad.

original: de la rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni slob pa'i lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni slob pa'i lhag par mos pa'o //

analyzed: shes pa zhes pa ni chos shes pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: mthong zhes pa ni chos shes par bzod ba la sogs pa'i shes rab bo //

original: mi slob pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dgra bcom pa ste /

original: bslab pa bcas pa'i gleng gzhi'i khungs so //
analyzed: bslab pa bcas pa'i gleng gzhi'i khungs so //

original: bcas pa zhes pa ni bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcas pa zhes pa ni bslab pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //

original: rjes su bcas pa zhes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rjes su bcas pa zhes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: sngon gnang ba las de'i yan lag tu bcas pa dang / sngon bkag pa las phyis gnang ba'o //
translated: the injunction of a branch of that which was previously permitted, and the permission of that which was previously prohibited.

original: dper na sngar lham 'chang du gnang ba las /
analyzed: dper na sngar lham 'chang du gnang ba las /
translated: For example, previously it was permitted to wear shoes,üîΩbut later it was prohibited to wear shoes with linings of animal skin.

original: krig krig zer ba dang / tsid tsid zer ba dang / dregs pa skye bar 'gyur ba rnams mi snang bar bcas pa lta bu dang / dus ma yin pa'i zas sngar bkag ste ma gnang ba las phyis nad kyi rkyen gyis gnang ba lta bu la sogs pa'o //

translated: The words not to be seen refer to the prohibition of the following: the wearing of ornaments, the use of high or luxurious seats, the eating of food at improper times, and the like.

analyzed: bkag ces pa ni chang lta bu nad kyi rkyen gyi phyir yang ma gnang ste ye bkag pa'o //

original: bar du gcod pa dang bar du mi gcod pa shes pa dang / bshad pa dang / rjes su ston pa'o zhes pa ni bar du gcod pa dang / mi gcod pa shes pa dang / de nyid gzhan la 'char nus pa dang mi bya ba las bzlog cing bya ba la 'jug par ston pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa dang bar du mi gcod pa shes pa dang / bshad pa dang / rjes su ston pa'o zhes pa ni bar du gcod pa dang / mi gcod pa shes pa dang / de nyid gzhan la 'char nus pa dang mi bya ba las bzlog cing bya ba la 'jug par ston pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the four‚Äîknowing what is and is not an obstacle, being able to explain that to others, turning away from what should not be done, and engaging in what should be done‚Äîare connected with what follows.

analyzed: gnas dang nye bar gnas pa 'chol nus pa dang sbyar zhes pa ni /

analyzed: bdag la gnas pa pha rol la re zhig gnas par 'chol ba'i mthu yod pa'i steng du gong ma bzhis bsnan te lnga phrugs gcig tu ston pa'o //

original: ltung @12b ba dang ; mi ltung ba dang / lci ba dang / yang ba shes pa dang / so sor thar pa rgyas par thon pa'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di lnga dang ldan pa lnga phrugs gcig tu ston te /

original: de la lci yang shes pa ni sbom po byung na /
analyzed: de la lci yang shes pa ni sbom po byung na /
translated: Knowing what is serious and what is not serious means that if a serious downfall occurs,

analyzed: rgan rabs de la gnas par bya ba'o //

analyzed: de nye gnas kyi bya ba kun bya 'am zhe na /

translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúExcept for the duty of prostrating.‚Äù

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas kyang lo lnga lon pa zhig na gnas med kyang yul rgyu ba rung bar ston pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan ni rig pa gsum dang ldan yang ma yin zhes pa ste /

analyzed: mi slong pa'i sngon gyi gnas dran pa dang / skye shi dang / zag pa med pa'i shes pa mngon du rig pa rnams yod kyang /

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo lngar ma lon na gnas med par yul rgyu mi gnang /

analyzed: gong du bar chad kyi chos dris la yongs su gtsang na /

analyzed: de yang ma gsod pa la sogs rab tu 'byung ba la bar du gcod pa dang / rkang lag 'jas 'grum la sogs pa /

analyzed: @13a * // 'dir ni lta ba'i bar du gcod pa las glengs pas na /

original: lpags mdog rnam bzhi zhes pa ni sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang skya bo bzhi lha'i mdog ltar bzang ba ma yin pa 'di bzhi gang dang ldan na'ang mi rung /

analyzed: gyal ba zhes pa ni gyal ba dngos kyang yin /

analyzed: gyol ba zhes pa ni gyol ba dngos kyang yin rkang pa gcig gi steng du gcig 'jog cing 'gro ba lta bur yang 'chad /

analyzed: lus kyi skyon ni mdog dang dbyibs ngan pa gong du smos pa rnams so //

analyzed: gcig cig gis cig car du ma bsnyen par rdzogs par byar rung ngam zhe na /

original: gcig ma yin pa mkhan po gcig gis cig car gsum man chad bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig ma yin pa mkhan po gcig gis cig car gsum man chad bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo zhes pa yin te /

analyzed: mkhan po yang gcig gsol ba la sogs te las kyang gcig ma yin pa ste /

analyzed: mi gsum man chad bsnyen par rdzogs bar byas na yang mi rung ba med par ston pa'o //

original: bzhi man chad ci phyir mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi man chad ci phyir mi rung zhe na /

analyzed: tshogs kyis tshogs kyi las mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe assembly does not perform the rite of the assembly.‚Äù

analyzed: cig car bsnyen par rdzogs pa de dag gis phyag ji ltar bya zhe na ;
translated: If those who are simultaneously conferred full ordination do not have seniority, how do they perform prostration?

original: dus ma nyams pa rnams gcig la gcig phyag bya ba med do zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: dus ma nyams pa rnams gcig la gcig phyag bya ba med do zhes pa yin no //

original: de dag rnyed pa dang las su gzhug pa gang snga zhe na /
analyzed: de dag rnyed pa dang las su gzhug pa gang snga zhe na /

original: phyin pa sdun du'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin pa sdun du'o zhes pa yin te /

original: rnyed pa'am las su bsko ba'i tshe gang sngar 'ongs pa de brtsan par byas te /
analyzed: rnyed pa'am las su bsko ba'i tshe gang sngar 'ongs pa de brtsan par byas te /
translated: When one acquires full ordination or is engaged in activity, the one who arrives first is considered senior.

analyzed: rnyed pa zhig na'ang des thob las su gzhug na yang de sngar bsko ba'o //

original: rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe skra bregs zhes kyang 'byung bas na skra bregs pa'i cho ga bran tshegs las 'byung ba rnams kyang cig car du bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba'i tshe skra bregs zhes kyang 'byung bas na skra bregs pa'i cho ga bran tshegs las 'byung ba rnams kyang cig car du bsdus te ston pa ni /

original: dgon pa pas skra sor gnyis las lhag par mi bcang zhes pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgon pa pas skra sor gnyis las lhag par mi bcang zhes pa la sogs pa yin no //

original: grong na ni de tsam du'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: grong na ni de tsam du'ang ma yin te /

analyzed: tshun chad ces ba ni grong bam gtsug lag khang bzhi la 'dug pa rnams kyis skra bregs pa ni sor gnyis srid du'ang mi gzhag par bregs pa'o //

analyzed: ba lang gi spu tsam gyi tshod du lhag ma cung zad yod par breg tu mi rung gi //

original: rma'i 'khor ma gtogs zhes pa yin te /

analyzed: mgo la rma yod na de'i nyen 'khor tsam rma la mi gzan par bya ba'i phyir chan pa'am gzhan gyis bregs kyang bla /

original: gzhan bregs na gtsug pud tsam @18a * //

translated: ‚ÄúNot where the Sa·πÖgha is sweeping‚Äù means that it is not suitable to shave the head where the Sa·πÖgha is sweeping and arranging the place where they will gather.

translated: The place where the Sa·πÖgha gathers, such as the courtyard, is pointed out and cleaned. It is also acceptable to shave the head there.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba 'di dge slong mas ma bsrungs par skyes pas skra mi breg ces pa ni dge slong ma 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa dge slong ma zla bo gcig gis ma bsrungs par skyes pa skra 'drag tu mi gzhug / chags
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba 'di dge slong mas ma bsrungs par skyes pas skra mi breg ces pa ni dge slong ma 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa dge slong ma zla bo gcig gis ma bsrungs par skyes pa skra 'drag tu mi gzhug / chags
translated: The statement, A man should not cut the hair of a nun who is not free from desire and who is not guarded by another nun, means that a man should not cut the hair of a nun who is not free from desire and who is not guarded by another nun.

original: pa lta na bsrung bas 'di skad du bsgo shig ces pa ni skra 'dreg pa'i dge slong ma de skyes pa 'dreg mkhan de la chags su byed na bsrung ba zla la 'dug pas mdo 'og nas 'byung ba skad du bsgo bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa lta na bsrung bas 'di skad du bsgo shig ces pa ni skra 'dreg pa'i dge slong ma de skyes pa 'dreg mkhan de la chags su byed na bsrung ba zla la 'dug pas mdo 'og nas 'byung ba skad du bsgo bar bya ba'o //
translated: If he is desirous, he should be told, Guard yourself! This means that if the nun who is cutting the hair is desirous of the man who is the barber, she should be guarded by a companion nun, as will be stated in a subsequent verse.

original: ci khog rul 'di la snying po yod dam zhes dran pa nye bar zhog cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci khog rul 'di la snying po yod dam zhes dran pa nye bar zhog cig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: You should reflect, Is there any essence in this putrid body?

original: ma sring dang bu mor soms shig ces 'dreg mkhan la'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ma sring dang bu mor soms shig ces 'dreg mkhan la'o zhes pa ni /
translated: You should reflect in this way to the barber.

original: 'dreg mkhan dge slong ma la chags pa lta na /
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan dge slong ma la chags pa lta na /
translated: If the barber is desirous of the nun,

original: dge slong ma de na tshod ji tsam pa las ma la sogs par soms shig ces 'dreg mkhan la bsrungs pas bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma de na tshod ji tsam pa las ma la sogs par soms shig ces 'dreg mkhan la bsrungs pas bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: The nun should tell the barber, Protect me as if I were your mother or sister, according to her age.

original: dge slong mas skra bregs pa'i cho ga de ltar bstan nas //
analyzed: dge slong mas skra bregs pa'i cho ga de ltar bstan nas //
translated: Having taught the ceremony of shaving the nun's head in this way,

original: da ni spyi'i cho ga ston te /üîΩ'di zin nas khrus bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: da ni spyi'i cho ga ston te / 'di zin nas khrus bya zhes pa ni /
translated: now the general ceremony is taught.üîΩIt is said, After this, bathe.

original: skra bregs zin nas khrus byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: skra bregs zin nas khrus byos shig pa'o //
translated: This means that after shaving, one should bathe.

original: yang na yan lag lnga bkru zhes pa ni lus ril gyis 'khru mi nus na mgo dang rkang lag bzhi tsam bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na yan lag lnga bkru zhes pa ni lus ril gyis 'khru mi nus na mgo dang rkang lag bzhi tsam bkru bar bya'o //
translated: Or, Wash the five limbs means that if one is unable to bathe the whole body, one should wash the head and the four limbs.

original: gcer bur mi bkru zhes pa ni pa char ram mdoms yog tsam yang med par khrus mi bya ba'o //üîΩdge slong ma @19a * //
analyzed: gcer bur mi bkru zhes pa ni pa char ram mdoms yog tsam yang med par khrus mi bya ba'o // dge slong ma @19a * //
translated: It is said, Do not bathe naked, meaning that one should not bathe without even a loincloth or a covering for the genitals.

original: skyes pa'i 'bab stegs su ma yin zhes pa ni skyes pa khrus byed pa'i sa gang yin par dge slong mas khrus mi bya /
analyzed: skyes pa'i 'bab stegs su ma yin zhes pa ni skyes pa khrus byed pa'i sa gang yin par dge slong mas khrus mi bya /
translated: It is said, Do not bathe in a place where men bathe, meaning that a nun should not bathe in a place where men bathe.

original: bud med kyi 'bab stegs su phye mas min zhes ni bud med khrus byed pa'i sar dge slong ma 'khru na phye mas su khrus mi bya'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi 'bab stegs su phye mas min zhes ni bud med khrus byed pa'i sar dge slong ma 'khru na phye mas su khrus mi bya'o //
translated: At a women‚Äôs bathing place, one should not bathe with flour.

original: sran phye la sogs pa dris bsad par rung zhes pa ni sran ma la sogs pa'i phye ma 'am me tog gam ga bur la sogs pa dri zhim pos kha blangs pa dge slong dang / dge slong mas spyad du mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sran phye la sogs pa dris bsad par rung zhes pa ni sran ma la sogs pa'i phye ma 'am me tog gam ga bur la sogs pa dri zhim pos kha blangs pa dge slong dang / dge slong mas spyad du mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: One may use fragrant substances such as sesame flour, flowers, and camphor.

original: 'di blang zhes pa ni gong ma'i phye ma lta bu gzhan gyis byin na long shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di blang zhes pa ni gong ma'i phye ma lta bu gzhan gyis byin na long shig par ston pa'o //
translated: One may accept these, meaning that if others offer sesame flour and so forth, one may accept it.

original: sman gyis bslang pa ni nad pas so zhes pas ni phye ma sman dang bsres pa zhig na nad pa nyi tshes blang du rung /
analyzed: sman gyis bslang pa ni nad pas so zhes pas ni phye ma sman dang bsres pa zhig na nad pa nyi tshes blang du rung /
translated: Medicinal powders may be used by the sick.

original: dge slong mas bud med la bye ma mi gtor zhes pa ni khrus byed pa'i tshe bud med gzhan la kyal ka bya ba'i phyir phye mas ma 'thor cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas bud med la bye ma mi gtor zhes pa ni khrus byed pa'i tshe bud med gzhan la kyal ka bya ba'i phyir phye mas ma 'thor cig pa'o //
translated: One should not throw flour at women.

original: gcer bus khrus ma byed cig ces bshad pa'i zla la gdoms lta bu yal ba 'am thang bar byar mi rung bar ston pa ni /
analyzed: gcer bus khrus ma byed cig ces bshad pa'i zla la gdoms lta bu yal ba 'am thang bar byar mi rung bar ston pa ni /
translated: The meaning of Do not tie the lower and upper robes together is that it is not proper to let them hang loose or be in disarray, as if one were naked.

original: sham thabs kyi snga gsham dang phyi gsham gyi tha ma ma mdud par skad la mi gzeg ces pa yin te /
analyzed: sham thabs kyi snga gsham dang phyi gsham gyi tha ma ma mdud par skad la mi gzeg ces pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of Do not hang them on a nail is that one should not hang them on a nail without tying the lower and upper robes together.

original: cho ga 'di ltar ma byas par skas nyi tshe la mi gzeg par ma zad kyi shing la sogs pa gang la yang gzeg tu mi rung /
analyzed: cho ga 'di ltar ma byas par skas nyi tshe la mi gzeg par ma zad kyi shing la sogs pa gang la yang gzeg tu mi rung /
translated: Not only should one not hang them on a nail without performing the rite in this way, but one should not hang them on anything, such as a tree.

original: skas pas gzhan du de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni steng du 'dzegs sam 'og du 'babs zin nas /
analyzed: skas pas gzhan du de ltar ma yin zhes pa ni steng du 'dzegs sam 'og du 'babs zin nas /
translated: The meaning of Except on a nail is that, having either climbed up or descended,

original: snga gsham dang phyi gsham gyi mdud pa de so na mi gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: snga gsham dang phyi gsham gyi mdud pa de so na mi gzhag pa'o //
translated: one should not leave the knot of the lower and upper robes as it is.

original: kha'i nang yar bzla bar gtogs pas na de'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩkha ma bkag par mi glal zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: kha'i nang yar bzla bar gtogs pas na de'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir / kha ma bkag par mi glal zhes pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of Do not yawn with the mouth open is that, since it is included in the rite of eating, it is taught as a rite for that.üîΩThe meaning of Do not wash the mouth with the drinking water is that one should not wash the mouth with the drinking water.

original: gcer bus khrus byar mi rung ba'i phyir khrus ras bcang zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gcer bus khrus byar mi rung ba'i phyir khrus ras bcang zhes pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of Do not bathe naked is that one should not bathe without a bathing cloth.

original: nyi rim la ni srog chags 'chags so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyi rim la ni srog chags 'chags so zhes pa ni /
translated: The line one should dry oneself in the sun means

original: chu srog chags mang po can gyis khrus byed na khrus ras nyi rim du byar mi rung ste /üîΩglan pa yang de bzhin chos gos gsum pas kyang de bzhin du khrus ras bcang dgos sam zhe na /
analyzed: chu srog chags mang po can gyis khrus byed na khrus ras nyi rim du byar mi rung ste / glan pa yang de bzhin chos gos gsum pas kyang de bzhin du khrus ras bcang dgos sam zhe na /
translated: that if one bathes in a place where there are many living beings in the water, one should not dry one's bathing robe in the sun.üîΩIf one is a practitioner of the three robes, does one also have to carry a bathing robe?

original: chos gos gsum pas kyang ngo zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos gsum pas kyang ngo zhes pa yin no //
translated: The line also means that even a practitioner of the three robes must carry a bathing robe.

original: khrus ras med dam mi bdog na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: khrus ras med dam mi bdog na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one does not have a bathing robe, or cannot afford one, what should one do?

original: med na mdun dang rgya ba 'dam pas g-yogs la dben ba'i phyogs su khrus bya zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: med na mdun dang rgya ba 'dam pas g-yogs la dben ba'i phyogs su khrus bya zhes pa yin no //
translated: The line if one does not have one, one should bathe in a secluded place, covering oneself with something in front and behind means that.

original: srog chags mang ste khrus ras gcig thang la yang chags pa tsam gyi tshod na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: srog chags mang ste khrus ras gcig thang la yang chags pa tsam gyi tshod na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If there are many living beings, and the bathing robe is just the right size to cover one's body, what should one do?

original: srog chags chags @19b pa bshal te btang zhes pa ni khrus ras la srog chags yod na chu'i nang du bshal zhing gtang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog chags chags @19b pa bshal te btang zhes pa ni khrus ras la srog chags yod na chu'i nang du bshal zhing gtang bar bya ba'o //
translated: The line one should let the living beings eat the bathing robe means that if the bathing robe has living beings on it, one should let them eat it in the water.

original: khrus gtsug lag khang du byed nas tshod gar bya ba bstan pa ni gtsug lag khang na stor khung de'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: khrus gtsug lag khang du byed nas tshod gar bya ba bstan pa ni gtsug lag khang na stor khung de'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The teaching on where to wash and urinate is: ‚ÄúThe urinal is in the temple.‚Äù

original: gtsug lag khang du khrus byed na stor khung ga la 'dug par khrus bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du khrus byed na stor khung ga la 'dug par khrus bya ba'o //
translated: If you wash in the temple, you should wash where the urinal is.

original: khu ba yang der dbo'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khu ba yang der dbo'o zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should also throw urine there.‚Äù

original: gos dang lhung bzed bkrus pa la sogs pa'i chu yang stor khung der dor ro //
analyzed: gos dang lhung bzed bkrus pa la sogs pa'i chu yang stor khung der dor ro //
translated: You should also throw away the water used for washing your clothes, begging-bowl, and so on, in the urinal.

original: khrus kyi sa gud du bstan pa'i phyir khrus khang bya zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: khrus kyi sa gud du bstan pa'i phyir khrus khang bya zhes pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should make a bathroom‚Äù is taught for the purpose of showing a separate place for washing.

original: der so phag gi gcal dgram zhes pa ni khrus khang gi nang du so phag gi gcal dgram par ston pa'o //
analyzed: der so phag gi gcal dgram zhes pa ni khrus khang gi nang du so phag gi gcal dgram par ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should lay bricks there‚Äù teaches that you should lay bricks in the bathroom.

original: stor khung gdod ces pa ni der stor khung yang gdod dgos pa'o //
analyzed: stor khung gdod ces pa ni der stor khung yang gdod dgos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou should make a urinal‚Äù teaches that you should also make a urinal there.

original: 'jim rdzab bkru zhes pa ni khrus khang de 'jim rdzab tu gyur na dus dus su bshal zhing bkru ba'o /
analyzed: 'jim rdzab bkru zhes pa ni khrus khang de 'jim rdzab tu gyur na dus dus su bshal zhing bkru ba'o /
translated: ‚ÄúYou should wash the mud‚Äù teaches that you should wash the mud in the bathroom from time to time.

original: chu khung du bkrus na mi ldang zhes pa ni chu khung ngam stor khung gi khar khrus khang gi nang 'jim rdzab tu mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: chu khung du bkrus na mi ldang zhes pa ni chu khung ngam stor khung gi khar khrus khang gi nang 'jim rdzab tu mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase if you wash in a water trough, it will not be sufficient means that the inside of the water trough or the drain should not become muddy with the bathhouse mud.

original: 'og nas smos pa 'di yang khrus kyi yan lag tu gtogs pas na skabs 'dir ston to //
analyzed: 'og nas smos pa 'di yang khrus kyi yan lag tu gtogs pas na skabs 'dir ston to //
translated: Since this is also mentioned below, it is taught here as part of the bathing procedure.

original: rkang pa gnyis ma gtogs par lus so phag gis mi spyang zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis ma gtogs par lus so phag gis mi spyang zhes pa yin no //
translated: The phrase except for the two feet, do not use the body as a scraper means that.

original: 'di ni dper zad kyi rtsub po dang sgeg pa yang ngo zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni dper zad kyi rtsub po dang sgeg pa yang ngo zhes pa ni /
translated: This is just an example, but it also refers to roughness and smoothness.

original: mtshon la sogs pa rnon po dang / rgya mtsho'i dbu ba la sogs pas sgag par byed pa yang mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshon la sogs pa rnon po dang / rgya mtsho'i dbu ba la sogs pas sgag par byed pa yang mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that it is not suitable to be rough with sharp weapons and so forth, or to be smooth with ocean foam and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsub po med par bdar ba'i nya phyis lus sbyang ba'i phyir chongs shig ces gsungs pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rtsub po med par bdar ba'i nya phyis lus sbyang ba'i phyir chongs shig ces gsungs pas na /
translated: Since the BhagavƒÅn said, Hold the oyster shell that is not rough, in order to cleanse the body,

original: nya phyis de lta bus lus sbyangs nas de nyid thabs ji ltar bkru ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nya phyis de lta bus lus sbyangs nas de nyid thabs ji ltar bkru ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach how to cleanse the body with such an oyster shell,

original: nya phyis mer bkru zhas pa yin te /
analyzed: nya phyis mer bkru zhas pa yin te /
translated: the phrase burn the oyster shell is stated.

original: nya phyis de thal ba 'am me la bsros na 'dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nya phyis de thal ba 'am me la bsros na 'dag par ston pa'o //
translated: It is taught that if the oyster is heated in ashes or fire, it will be purified.

original: dge slong gi lus ni cung zad sbyong du gnang gi / dge slong ma'i lus ni sbyong du ye mi gnang par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong gi lus ni cung zad sbyong du gnang gi / dge slong ma'i lus ni sbyong du ye mi gnang par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it is permitted for monks to clean the body a little, but it is never permitted for nuns to clean the body,

original: dge slong ma ni gang du yang khu tshur dang ra da yan chad gang gis kyang mi brud ces pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong ma ni gang du yang khu tshur dang ra da yan chad gang gis kyang mi brud ces pa yin te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúA nun should not scratch anywhere with anything, even with her fist or fingernails.‚Äù

original: khu tshur dang ra da yan chad bzan pa gang gis kyang lus kyi yan lag gang du yang mi brud pa'o //
analyzed: khu tshur dang ra da yan chad bzan pa gang gis kyang lus kyi yan lag gang du yang mi brud pa'o //
translated: She should not scratch any part of her body with anything, even with her fist or fingernails.

original: khrus kyi zhor la gos bgo ba'i rim gro yang bstan dgos pas na /
analyzed: khrus kyi zhor la gos bgo ba'i rim gro yang bstan dgos pas na /
translated: Since it is necessary to teach the procedure for putting on clothes after bathing,

original: chu ma skams par yod bzhin du gos mi bgo zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: chu ma skams par yod bzhin du gos mi bgo zhes pa yin te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúDo not put on clothes while the water is still there.‚Äù

original: chu 'brum ma skams kyi bar du gos ma gyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: chu 'brum ma skams kyi bar du gos ma gyon cig pa'o //
translated: Do not put on clothes until the water blisters have dried.

original: de lta bas na lus phyi ba bcang zhes pa yin te /üîΩchu 'brum myur du med @20a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus phyi ba bcang zhes pa yin te / chu 'brum myur du med @20a * //
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúYou should carry a towel.‚Äù

original: par 'dod pas lus phyi ba chongs shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: par 'dod pas lus phyi ba chongs shig par ston pa'o //
translated: Since you want the water blisters to disappear quickly, it teaches that you should carry a towel.

original: lus phyi ba med na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: lus phyi ba med na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If there is no one to wash the body, what should be done?

original: med na skad cig tsog tsog por 'dug la khrus ras kyis phyi zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: med na skad cig tsog tsog por 'dug la khrus ras kyis phyi zhes pa yin no //
translated: If there is no one, one should sit in a squatting position for a moment and wash with a towel.

original: khrus kyi zhar la bsro gang yang 'byung ba'i rigs bas na /
analyzed: khrus kyi zhar la bsro gang yang 'byung ba'i rigs bas na /
translated: Since it is appropriate to bathe and warm the body at the same time,

original: bsro gang du 'jug par bya zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsro gang du 'jug par bya zhes pa yin no //
translated: one should enter the sauna.

original: bsro gang de ji lta bur bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsro gang de ji lta bur bya zhe na /
translated: How should that sauna be made?

original: bso gang bya ba ni skam sar dge'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bso gang bya ba ni skam sar dge'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The sauna should be built on dry land.

original: khrus khang gi dar ram tshan yod par brtsigs na grang zhing tshan ldang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khrus khang gi dar ram tshan yod par brtsigs na grang zhing tshan ldang ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is built in the bathing house, it will be cold and the heat will not rise.

original: skam sar brtsigs na legs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: skam sar brtsigs na legs par ston pa'o //
translated: If it is built on dry land, it is well taught.üîΩThe sauna window should be wide on the inside and narrow on the outside, like the ocean.

original: skar khung phyi dog nang yangs pa rgya mtsho lta bur dbus su gdod ces pa ni bsro gang gi skar khung dbyibs 'di 'dra bar byas pa rtsig pa'i dbus su gdod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: skar khung phyi dog nang yangs pa rgya mtsho lta bur dbus su gdod ces pa ni bsro gang gi skar khung dbyibs 'di 'dra bar byas pa rtsig pa'i dbus su gdod par bya ba'o //
translated: The sauna window should be made in this shape and placed in the middle of the wall.

original: skar khung 'dir dra ba dang sgo 'phar dang / zung nga dang / gzer gtan dang / zung nga bya zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: skar khung 'dir dra ba dang sgo 'phar dang / zung nga dang / gzer gtan dang / zung nga bya zhes pa yin te /
translated: This window has a lattice, a door, a bolt, a pin, and a bolt-receiving post.

original: bsro gang de'i skar khung dra bas g-yogs pa dang / sgo leb can du bya ba la sogs pa'ang ming gis smos pa bzhin du bya /
analyzed: bsro gang de'i skar khung dra bas g-yogs pa dang / sgo leb can du bya ba la sogs pa'ang ming gis smos pa bzhin du bya /
translated: The window of that sauna should be covered with a lattice, made with a door, and so forth, as stated by name.

original: ra rkang gi dbyug pa gzhag ces pa ni skar khung gcad cing dbye ba'i spyad dbyug gi thog ma rmig pa lta bur byas pa yang bcas te gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: ra rkang gi dbyug pa gzhag ces pa ni skar khung gcad cing dbye ba'i spyad dbyug gi thog ma rmig pa lta bur byas pa yang bcas te gzhag pa'o //
translated: The leg of a goat is placed as a handle is to say, the handle of the saw for cutting and opening the window is made like a hoof and is attached.

original: sgor sgo leb dang gtan bu dang / yang mig dang lag zangs bca' zhes pa ni bsro gang de gtan bu dang sgo leb dang phyi nang nas gcad cing dbye ba'i yang mig dang lag zungs yan chad phrugs yan chad tshang bar shoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: sgor sgo leb dang gtan bu dang / yang mig dang lag zangs bca' zhes pa ni bsro gang de gtan bu dang sgo leb dang phyi nang nas gcad cing dbye ba'i yang mig dang lag zungs yan chad phrugs yan chad tshang bar shoms shig pa'o //
translated: The door has a door-panel, a bolt, a keyhole, and a door-handle is to say, the sauna should be equipped with a bolt, a door-panel, a keyhole for opening and closing from the outside and inside, and a door-handle, and so forth.

original: nang gi ngos su chu tshan gzhag pa'i phyir stegs bu bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nang gi ngos su chu tshan gzhag pa'i phyir stegs bu bya zhes pa ni /
translated: On the inside, a platform should be made for placing hot water.

original: bsro gang gi nang du chu gzhag pa'i sa yang 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsro gang gi nang du chu gzhag pa'i sa yang 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: And put water in the warming pan in this way.

original: zhugs thab kyi sar pha gu gding zhes pa ni gzhi pha gu las blangs la de'i steng du gdod zhugs thab byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: zhugs thab kyi sar pha gu gding zhes pa ni gzhi pha gu las blangs la de'i steng du gdod zhugs thab byos shig pa'o //
translated: The line On the hearth, set up a fence means: take a fence from somewhere else and put it on top of that, and then make the hearth.

original: mi 'chi bar bsdu zhes pa ni me spos shig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi bar bsdu zhes pa ni me spos shig par ston pa'o //
translated: The line Gather it without letting it go out shows that you should not let the fire go out.

original: de'i phyir lcags kyi lad phyag bcang zhes ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lcags kyi lad phyag bcang zhes ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the line Keep a pair of iron tongs means

translated: At the end, the three continuums refers to the three continuums that one should read after one has finished bathing: the continuum of praise to the Three Jewels, the continuum of the s≈´tras, and the continuum of the Vinaya.

translated: The line Do not do this to your body out of disrespect means

analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon ni tshul khrims dang mi ldan na yang g-yog bya'o zhes pa ni / mkhan po dang slob dpon @22a * //
translated: One should serve a preceptor or an ƒÅcƒÅrya, even if he does not have morality.

translated: If a preceptor or an ƒÅcƒÅrya has a defeating offense,

translated: The line Not in a defiled place means that you should do it in a clean place.

analyzed: 'dir mi dor zhes pa ni bab bab tu ye mi dor ba la bya /
translated: ‚ÄúNot to be thrown away‚Äù here means that one should not throw it away just anywhere.

analyzed: de'i phyir glo phug bya zhes pa ni lhung bzed gzhag pa'i phyir rtsid ngos la phug gdod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA peg‚Äù means that one should drive a peg into the wall in order to hang the alms bowl.

translated: If one digs the wall immediately for a peg, the wall will collapse. Therefore, one should dig the wall of the monastery or the house for a peg after it has been built.üîΩHaving explained how those who live in the village should care for their alms bowls,

translated: The phrase place it in a container and carry it means that when you are going to a guest house,

translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù shows that one should use even the shards from the kiln.

analyzed: rdzam las bcos pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na / thal bas bkang la rdza gzong gis bcag na dge zhes pa yin no //
translated: How should one make the kiln?üîΩOne should fill it with ashes and break it with a potter‚Äôs tool.

original: 'di bcang zhes pa ni gong ma lta bur dgos pas na rdza ma bcag pa'i gzong bu chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bcang zhes pa ni gong ma lta bur dgos pas na rdza ma bcag pa'i gzong bu chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúkeep‚Äù means that one should keep a potter‚Äôs tool for breaking the kiln as described above.

original: rdza ma de cir dgos she na /üîΩdu ba mi 'byer bar des dgab ces pa yin te /
analyzed: rdza ma de cir dgos she na / du ba mi 'byer bar des dgab ces pa yin te /
translated: For what purpose is the kiln?üîΩIt is for covering it so that smoke does not escape.

original: du ba mi 'chor ba rdza ma des bya'o //üîΩphyi rol 'jim phub kyis bsku zhes pa ni /üîΩrdza ma de'i phyi rol phub ma dang 'ji bar bsres @25b pas skus shig pa'o //
analyzed: du ba mi 'chor ba rdza ma des bya'o // phyi rol 'jim phub kyis bsku zhes pa ni / rdza ma de'i phyi rol phub ma dang 'ji bar bsres @25b pas skus shig pa'o //
translated: The kiln prevents the smoke from escaping.üîΩOne should cover the outside with a layer of clay.üîΩOne should cover the outside of the kiln with a mixture of clay and chaff.

original: nang 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma 'am lci bas bskus zhes pa ni rdza ma de'i nang 'dis skus shig pa'o //
analyzed: nang 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma 'am lci bas bskus zhes pa ni rdza ma de'i nang 'dis skus shig pa'o //
translated: One should cover the inside with chaff or mud.

original: rdza ma de phyi nang bskus ma thag du dgab pa 'am zhe na skam thag chad na 'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: rdza ma de phyi nang bskus ma thag du dgab pa 'am zhe na skam thag chad na 'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: The pot is covered as soon as it is smeared inside and out.  Yes, he says, when it is dry.

original: sa ji lta bu dang gzhi ji ltar bkrum par lhung bzed gzhag cing rdza mas dgab ce na /üîΩgzhi byi bdar byas la phub ma bting nas 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa du ba bzang po'i rdzas dgod cing khas bub tu gzhag ces pa yin te /
analyzed: sa ji lta bu dang gzhi ji ltar bkrum par lhung bzed gzhag cing rdza mas dgab ce na / gzhi byi bdar byas la phub ma bting nas 'bru mar gyi tshigs ma la sogs pa du ba bzang po'i rdzas dgod cing khas bub tu gzhag ces pa yin te /
translated: On what kind of ground and how should the bowl be placed and covered with the pot?üîΩThe ground should be swept, a mat spread, and the substances of good incense such as sesame oil placed, and it should be placed upside down.

original: lci ba dang sog mas bskor te sbar zhes pa ni rdza ma de'i phyi rol 'di rnams kyis bskor la me btang ba'o //
analyzed: lci ba dang sog mas bskor te sbar zhes pa ni rdza ma de'i phyi rol 'di rnams kyis bskor la me btang ba'o //
translated: Surrounding it with dung and grass, it should be lit means that these things should surround the outside of the pot and fire should be set.

original: te por grangs nas gzhig ces pa ni bsregs pa de dag grangs nas gzod gzhig par bya'o //
analyzed: te por grangs nas gzhig ces pa ni bsregs pa de dag grangs nas gzod gzhig par bya'o //
translated: When it is counted as hot, it should be removed means that when it is counted as hot, it should be removed.

original: tshon legs par ma zhen na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshon legs par ma zhen na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If the color does not adhere well, what should be done?

original: tshon ma zhen pa grub kyi bar du bzlas zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: tshon ma zhen pa grub kyi bar du bzlas zhes pa yin no //
translated: The color should be recited until it is established.

original: bzlas pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should the method of recitation be done?

original: bkru zhing bkru zhing gzhag ces pa yin te /
analyzed: bkru zhing bkru zhing gzhag ces pa yin te /
translated: It should be washed and washed and placed.

original: tshon ma zhen na legs par bkrus la yang sngon gyi sor gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: tshon ma zhen na legs par bkrus la yang sngon gyi sor gzhag pa'o //
translated: If the colors are not fixed, wash it well and put it back as before.

original: srog chags la brtse ba'i phyir than kor phyags shing chag chag ga dang ces pa ni ma bsregs pa'i than kor du srog chags mang po bsal ba'i phyir phyag dar dang chag chag gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags la brtse ba'i phyir than kor phyags shing chag chag ga dang ces pa ni ma bsregs pa'i than kor du srog chags mang po bsal ba'i phyir phyag dar dang chag chag gyis shig pa'o //
translated: In order to be kind to living beings, sweep the vicinity and sprinkle it with water. This means that in order to remove many living beings from the vicinity that has not been burned, sweep and sprinkle it with water.

original: gong du lhung bzed med na rab tu mi dbyung zhes smos pa'i zhar la lhung bzed kyi cho ga rgyas par bstan nas //
analyzed: gong du lhung bzed med na rab tu mi dbyung zhes smos pa'i zhar la lhung bzed kyi cho ga rgyas par bstan nas //
translated: Above it says that if one does not have a begging bowl, one should not be fully admitted. In this context, the extensive ritual of the begging bowl is taught.

original: phran tshegs la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i rab tu 'byung ba'i dngos por gtogs pa gzhan yang ston pa ni /
analyzed: phran tshegs la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i rab tu 'byung ba'i dngos por gtogs pa gzhan yang ston pa ni /
translated: Other things that are included in the actual going forth that are found in the Ksudraka and other texts are also taught.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i lo tshigs mi shes na mtshan gyi 'khor spu skyes pa rung bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te mtshan gyi 'khor spus 'khor na rung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i lo tshigs mi shes na mtshan gyi 'khor spu skyes pa rung bar bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te mtshan gyi 'khor spus 'khor na rung bar bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not know the age at which one was fully admitted, one should determine it by the appearance of the hair of the sexual organ and so on. If the hair of the sexual organ appears, it is determined.

original: de brtag pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de brtag pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is that determined?

original: 'di sgyus brtag ces pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di sgyus brtag ces pa yin te /
translated: It is determined by the method of deception.

original: des ma 'phrigs par thabs kyis brtag pa'o //
analyzed: des ma 'phrigs par thabs kyis brtag pa'o //
translated: He does not understand, so he examines with a trick.

original: sgyus brtag pa'i thabs ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sgyus brtag pa'i thabs ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the method of examining with a trick?

original: glang po so dang gos dag dang mthon po na yod pa'i rdzas len du gzhug pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po so dang gos dag dang mthon po na yod pa'i rdzas len du gzhug pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: It is like making someone go to get the tusk of an elephant, cloth, or a substance that is high up.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug ces pa ni sman 'grums su 'gyur ba'i nyen spang ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa shing la 'dzeg tu mi gzhug ces pa ni sman 'grums su 'gyur ba'i nyen spang ba'o //
translated: One who wishes to be fully ordained should not be made to climb a tree means to avoid the danger of becoming sick.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol tu mi gtang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol tu mi gtang zhes pa ni /
translated: One should not be sent outside the boundary.

original: bar chad kyi chos rnams kyis mi tshugs par bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos rnams kyis mi tshugs par bya'o //
translated: This is to prevent being harmed by obstacles.

original: bsnyen bar rdzogs par 'dod pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtang na dge 'dun @26a * //
analyzed: bsnyen bar rdzogs par 'dod pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du mi gtang na dge 'dun @26a * //
translated: If one who wishes to be fully ordained is not sent outside the boundary, the Sa·πÖgha

original: dbye ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las byed cing gsang ste ston pas zhu ba'i tshe gar gzhag ce na /
analyzed: dbye ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las byed cing gsang ste ston pas zhu ba'i tshe gar gzhag ce na /
translated: performs the full ordination ceremony and when the inquirer is questioned by the preceptor, where should he be placed?

original: 'di mthong ba'i spyod lam du spangs nas tshogs la thal mo sbyar te mdun gyis lta bar gzhag ces pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di mthong ba'i spyod lam du spangs nas tshogs la thal mo sbyar te mdun gyis lta bar gzhag ces pa yin no //
translated: It is said that he should be placed in front, with palms joined, having abandoned the conduct of seeing this.

original: khyim pa la gnas mi bsgo zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa la gnas mi bsgo zhes pa ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bar chad du mi 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not assign a place to a layperson‚Äù means that you should not create an obstacle to his going forth.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu mi bsgo ba ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs ma thag tu mi bsgo ba ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not assign a place to someone who has just been fully ordained‚Äù means that

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho bka' blo bde bas na de la spyid du'ang mi rung ste /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho bka' blo bde bas na de la spyid du'ang mi rung ste /
translated: because someone who has just been fully ordained is happy to follow the rules, it is not appropriate to assign him a place.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la gnas phyis bsgo ba dang chos gos bor te babs pa'i gleng gzhi yod pas na'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la gnas phyis bsgo ba dang chos gos bor te babs pa'i gleng gzhi yod pas na'o //
translated: This is because there is a story about a young brahmin who was assigned a place later and who took off his Dharma robes and jumped into the water.

original: gang na gnas med pa der gso sbyin mi bsdang tshul du mi 'jug ces pa ni gnas med na gso sbyin ma zin gyi bar du bsdad pa dang / tshul du 'jug pa ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: gang na gnas med pa der gso sbyin mi bsdang tshul du mi 'jug ces pa ni gnas med na gso sbyin ma zin gyi bar du bsdad pa dang / tshul du 'jug pa ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not enter a place where there is no place‚Äù means that if there is no place, you should not stay until the po·π£adha ceremony is finished, or enter the ceremony.

original: tshul du zhugs pa'i 'og tu gnas med par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshul du zhugs pa'i 'og tu gnas med par gyur na ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should you do if you enter the ceremony and then there is no place?üîΩ‚ÄúDo not protect the earlier entry‚Äù means that

original: tshul snga mar zhugs pa mi bsrungs zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul snga mar zhugs pa mi bsrungs zhes pa yin te /
translated: you should not protect the earlier entry.

original: tshul snga ma gral la gnas pa ga la yod par tshul phyi mar bsnyag / tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas med par gyur pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshul snga ma gral la gnas pa ga la yod par tshul phyi mar bsnyag / tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas med par gyur pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one who has entered the latter mode becomes one who is not in residence, what should he do?

original: phyi mar zla ba gnyis las lhag par yang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi mar zla ba gnyis las lhag par yang zhes pa yin te /
translated: The latter is stated as more than two months.

original: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas med par gyur na zla ba gnyis las lhag par ma 'dug shig pa'o //
analyzed: tshul phyi mar zhugs pa las gnas med par gyur na zla ba gnyis las lhag par ma 'dug shig pa'o //
translated: If one who has entered the latter mode becomes one who is not in residence, he should not stay more than two months.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas brtsal ba'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gnas brtsal ba'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one seek a residence in another monastery?

original: 'di gnas dang las dang g-yog spangs pas gnyer zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnas dang las dang g-yog spangs pas gnyer zhes pa yin te /
translated: This is stated as seeking it by abandoning residence, work, and attendants.

original: gtsug lag khang gud nas gnas su bod pa de la gnas bzang po dang las su mi gzhug pa dang / dge tshul la sogs pa de'i g-yog tu bskos pa rnams sud du mi bsko bas khas blangs te gnyer cig ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gud nas gnas su bod pa de la gnas bzang po dang las su mi gzhug pa dang / dge tshul la sogs pa de'i g-yog tu bskos pa rnams sud du mi bsko bas khas blangs te gnyer cig ba'o //
translated: Having been sent to another monastery, he should seek it by promising to abandon a good residence, not to engage in work, and not to appoint novices, etc. as his attendants.

original: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du gnas med par 'khod pa'i cho sul dri zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi bar du gnas med par 'khod pa'i cho sul dri zhe na /
translated: If one is not in residence for more than two months, what should he do?

original: med na gzhon nu'i rgan rabs la yang dre zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: med na gzhon nu'i rgan rabs la yang dre zhes pa yin te /
translated: If not, then ask the elder of the young monks.

original: gnas bca' ba'i 'os med na /
analyzed: gnas bca' ba'i 'os med na /
translated: If there is no suitable place to stay,

original: gzhon nu'i nang nas gang rgan rabs la dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhon nu'i nang nas gang rgan rabs la dris shig pa'o //
translated: ask the elder of the young monks.

original: rgan pa des ni ma dris par byas kyang nyes med par zhar la mngon no /
analyzed: rgan pa des ni ma dris par byas kyang nyes med par zhar la mngon no /
translated: The elder is not at fault if he does not ask.üîΩEven if there is a teacher, ask the attendant.

original: yod kyang nye gnas su 'o zhes pa ne mkhan po dang gnas yod du zin kyang slob pa gzhon nu'i rgan rabs gzhan la nye gnas su 'dri ba nyes pa med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yod kyang nye gnas su 'o zhes pa ne mkhan po dang gnas yod du zin kyang slob pa gzhon nu'i rgan rabs gzhan la nye gnas su 'dri ba nyes pa med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that even if there is a teacher and a place to stay, it is not a fault to ask another elder of the young monks who is a student.üîΩThe teaching in the context of asking is:

original: dri ba'i zhar la @26b bstan pa ni de'i rigs ma zhus par des sam bdag gis mi bkol zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: dri ba'i zhar la @26b bstan pa ni de'i rigs ma zhus par des sam bdag gis mi bkol zhes pa yin te /
translated: If you do not ask about his lineage, do not use him or I.

original: mkhan po la sogs pa la ma zhus par tshul khrims dang mi ldan ba'i rigs bdag gis kyang mi bkol des kyang mi bkol ba 'ang mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po la sogs pa la ma zhus par tshul khrims dang mi ldan ba'i rigs bdag gis kyang mi bkol des kyang mi bkol ba 'ang mi bya'o //
translated: If you do not ask the preceptor and so forth, do not use someone who is not ethical, nor should you use me.

original: gong du gnas med par ma 'dug cig ces ba de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gong du gnas med par ma 'dug cig ces ba de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the specific meaning of the above statement, ‚ÄúDo not stay in a place without a teacher,‚Äù

original: med pa tshol ba'i tshe gnas par 'os pa mi gnas par 'dug kyang nyes med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa tshol ba'i tshe gnas par 'os pa mi gnas par 'dug kyang nyes med ces pa yin te /
translated: When one is seeking a place to stay, if one stays without a proper place, there is no fault.

original: gnas snying nas tshol na de ma rnyed kyi bar du gnas bca' dgos pa /
analyzed: gnas snying nas tshol na de ma rnyed kyi bar du gnas bca' dgos pa /
translated: If one seeks a place with a sincere heart, one must stay until one finds it.

original: gnas med par 'dug kyang nyes pa med par ston ba'o //
analyzed: gnas med par 'dug kyang nyes pa med par ston ba'o //
translated: This shows that there is no fault in staying without a place.

original: de ltar rung ba ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar rung ba ji srid kyi bar du zhe na /
translated: For how long is it proper to do it that way?

original: zhag lnga'i bar du zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: zhag lnga'i bar du zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is for as long as five days.

original: zhag lnga lon gyi bar du gnas med par 'dug kyang sla ba'o //
analyzed: zhag lnga lon gyi bar du gnas med par 'dug kyang sla ba'o //
translated: It is easy to stay without a place for as long as five days.

original: gzhag lnga'i bar du gnas med bar 'dug pa'i tshe rnyed pa blang du rung ngam mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: gzhag lnga'i bar du gnas med bar 'dug pa'i tshe rnyed pa blang du rung ngam mi rung zhe na /
translated: When one stays without a place for five days, is it proper to accept gain or not?

original: rnyed pa ni 'os so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rnyed pa ni 'os so zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is proper to accept gain.

original: de'i tshe rnyed pa yang blang du rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rnyed pa yang blang du rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that it is proper to accept gain at that time.

original: gzhi la 'khod pa rnams kyi gnas ji ltar bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: gzhi la 'khod pa rnams kyi gnas ji ltar bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Having explained how to act in a place that one has settled in,

original: 'dron po rnams kyi gnas bstan pa'i phyir lhags pa ni zhag gnyis sam gsum brtas te gnas blang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dron po rnams kyi gnas bstan pa'i phyir lhags pa ni zhag gnyis sam gsum brtas te gnas blang zhes pa yin te /
translated: in order to explain how to act in a place for travelers, it says, ‚ÄúIf one has come for two or three days, one should accept a place to stay.‚Äù

original: gud nas 'dron du lhags pa ni lhags ma thag tu gnas bca' mi dgos kyi zhag gnyis sam gsum brtas nas gdod gnas nos shig pa'o //
analyzed: gud nas 'dron du lhags pa ni lhags ma thag tu gnas bca' mi dgos kyi zhag gnyis sam gsum brtas nas gdod gnas nos shig pa'o //
translated: As for those who come to join the community later, they should not take up residence immediately but should wait two or three days to see if anyone objects.

original: zhag gcig gi phyir ma yin zhes pa ni zhag 'ga' las mi 'dug pa gnas bca' mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: zhag gcig gi phyir ma yin zhes pa ni zhag 'ga' las mi 'dug pa gnas bca' mi dgos pa'o //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúnot for the sake of a single day,‚Äù this means that if someone is not going to stay more than a few days, there is no need to take up residence.

original: gnas la zhur mchud pa'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas la zhur mchud pa'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done when one is about to leave the monastery?

original: gnas mi khom na gzhan la dri zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas mi khom na gzhan la dri zhes pa yin te /
translated: If the monastery is not crowded, one should ask others.

original: mtshams kyi nang na brel yang rung gud du song yang rung drir med na 'phral du mi bya ba tsam gyi tshod gzhan la dris kyang nyes med /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na brel yang rung gud du song yang rung drir med na 'phral du mi bya ba tsam gyi tshod gzhan la dris kyang nyes med /
translated: If there is no one to ask, whether one is in a hurry or has time to spare, one should simply not leave immediately. It is permissible to ask others, but if one does not, there is no fault.

original: gnas la ma dris par gnas pas bya ba mi bya zhes gong du bstan pa de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir las kyi phyir song ba las gzhan gyis bsnan pa ma dris kyang nyes med ces pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas la ma dris par gnas pas bya ba mi bya zhes gong du bstan pa de'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir las kyi phyir song ba las gzhan gyis bsnan pa ma dris kyang nyes med ces pa yin te /
translated: The following verse is stated to illustrate the exception to the rule taught above, that one should not do anything without asking permission to do so.

original: sngar dge 'dun gyis mngags pa gnas la zhus te song pa las 'di lta bu zhig kyang gyis shig ces bsnan pa lta bu gnas la ma dris par byas kyang nyes med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: sngar dge 'dun gyis mngags pa gnas la zhus te song pa las 'di lta bu zhig kyang gyis shig ces bsnan pa lta bu gnas la ma dris par byas kyang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that it is not a fault to do something without asking permission if one was previously sent by the Sa·πÖgha and one adds something to the original request.

original: gnas nos shig pa su la'ang nod du rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: gnas nos shig pa su la'ang nod du rung ngam zhe na /
translated: Is it suitable to take the novitiate in front of anyone?

original: bab bab kyi gan du ma yin zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bab bab kyi gan du ma yin zhes pa yin no //
translated: It is not in front of anyone, but in front of the Sangha.
Well then,

original: su la zhe na /
analyzed: su la zhe na /
translated: in front of whom?

original: khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor dang phan 'dogs pa dri ba la sogs pas shes par bya zhing sdom pa bzhin du 'di nod ces pa yin te /
analyzed: khrims dang shes pa dang 'khor dang phan 'dogs pa dri ba la sogs pas shes par bya zhing sdom pa bzhin du 'di nod ces pa yin te /
translated: It is in front of those who know the rules, who know the Vinaya, who know the rules and the Vinaya, and who know the rules, the Vinaya, and the scriptures.

original: dge slong gang gnas su bya ba de tshul khrims dang ldan na ma mi ldan mang du thos sam ma thos /
analyzed: dge slong gang gnas su bya ba de tshul khrims dang ldan na ma mi ldan mang du thos sam ma thos /
translated: The monk who is to be the preceptor should be one who has ethics, is learned, has a following, and is helpful.üîΩHe should be asked about his name and so forth, and he should be asked if he will give the vows.üîΩThe monk who is to be the preceptor should have ethics, be learned, have a following, and be helpful.

original: 'khor bgrungs sam mi bgrungs /
analyzed: 'khor bgrungs sam mi bgrungs /
translated: He should be asked about his name and so forth, and he should be asked if he will give the vows.

original: phan thogs sam mi thogs dri ba la sogs pas brtag cing myong la 'di rnams dang ldan na sngom pa mnod pa dang 'dra bar sngags kyi tshig lan gsum gyi bar du bzlas shing nos shig pa'o //

original: sgo brdung zhing nang na 'dug pa shes par bya zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyi gnas khang du 'gro na gnas ba nyi tshe ma yin gyi sus kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sgo brdung zhing nang na 'dug pa shes par bya zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyi gnas khang du 'gro na gnas ba nyi tshe ma yin gyi sus kyang rung ste /
translated: The phrase knocking on the door and making his presence known means that when a monk goes to the dwelling of another monk, he should not do so only when the other is absent.

original: 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase in this way refers to the following:

original: dal gyis zhes pa ni gong ma ltar brdung ba yang ma drag shig pa'o //
analyzed: dal gyis zhes pa ni gong ma ltar brdung ba yang ma drag shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase gently means that the knocking should not be too loud, as described above.

original: yun mi ring zhes pa ni brdung ba yun ma ring shig pa'o //
analyzed: yun mi ring zhes pa ni brdung ba yun ma ring shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase for a short time means that the knocking should not be done for a long time.

original: 'di drag tu mi phul zhes pa ni sgo 'byed cing gcod pa ma drag shig pa'o //üîΩsgo skyes la mi drud par dal gyis shes bzhin du 'jug cing 'byung zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di drag tu mi phul zhes pa ni sgo 'byed cing gcod pa ma drag shig pa'o // sgo skyes la mi drud par dal gyis shes bzhin du 'jug cing 'byung zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase without force means that the door should be opened and closed without force.üîΩ The phrase without dragging the bolt across the door means that one should enter and leave the dwelling gently and mindfully.

original: sgo'i phyi'i nang du 'gro ba la zon yong pa 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sgo'i phyi'i nang du 'gro ba la zon yong pa 'di ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase in this way refers to the following:

original: 'di la bsti stang bya zhes pa ni gnas la bsti stang skyed cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la bsti stang bya zhes pa ni gnas la bsti stang skyed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase with respect means that one should show respect for the dwelling.

original: gzhar par bya zhes pa ni gnas pas gnas las ma phang bar chor cig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhar par bya zhes pa ni gnas pas gnas las ma phang bar chor cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase with care means that one should not leave the dwelling carelessly.

original: de dang mi mthun pa la ma yin zhes pa ni gnas de dang mi mdza' ba dang ma bsten cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa la ma yin zhes pa ni gnas de dang mi mdza' ba dang ma bsten cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase not in a place that is not suitable means not in a place that is not agreeable or not conducive to those activities.

original: 'di la 'dzem par bya zhes pa ni gnas pas gnas la'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'dzem par bya zhes pa ni gnas pas gnas la'o //
translated: The phrase you should be circumspect means that you should be circumspect about the place where you are staying.

original: de'i bya ba la dngom par bya zhes pa ni gnas de'i las su bya ba rnams la gsong zhing dngom par bya dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba la dngom par bya zhes pa ni gnas de'i las su bya ba rnams la gsong zhing dngom par bya dgos pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should be conscientious about your actions means that you should be conscientious and careful about the activities that you are engaged in at that place.

original: gzab cing bya zhes pa ni chos gos drub pa la sogs pa de'i las su bya ba rnams la gzab cing gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzab cing bya zhes pa ni chos gos drub pa la sogs pa de'i las su bya ba rnams la gzab cing gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should be attentive means that you should be attentive and careful about the activities that you are engaged in at that place, such as sewing your robes.

original: mdzes pa'i gam zul zhes pa ni gnas de'i las byed pa nag ma zul yod cing mdzes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i gam zul zhes pa ni gnas de'i las byed pa nag ma zul yod cing mdzes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should be attractive means that you should be attractive and not ugly in your performance of the activities of that place.

original: khrel dang ldan pa zhes pa ni gnas de'i las su bya ba rnams blun cing khrel gyis dogs par gyis shig pa'o //üîΩrje sa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni gnas kyi bya ba rnams la rjes dang ldan bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: khrel dang ldan pa zhes pa ni gnas de'i las su bya ba rnams blun cing khrel gyis dogs par gyis shig pa'o //üîΩrje sa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni gnas kyi bya ba rnams la rjes dang ldan bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase you should be modest means that you should be modest and fearful of offending in your performance of the activities of that place.üîΩThe phrase you should be deferential means that you should be deferential in your performance of the activities of that place.

original: rje bo yod pa zhes pa ni gnas re la rje bo lta bur gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rje bo yod pa zhes pa ni gnas re la rje bo lta bur gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase as if there were a master means that you should act as if there were a master in every place.

original: dma' ba'i sems zhes pa ni bsnyems shing dregs ba'i sems med par de'i bya ba byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: dma' ba'i sems zhes pa ni bsnyems shing dregs ba'i sems med par de'i bya ba byos shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase with a humble mind means that you should do his work without a mind of pride and arrogance.

original: rang gi bya ba la mi gcod par shes bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gi klog pa dang bsam pa la mi gnod par de'i las gyis shig pa'o //üîΩji dger tshol ba zhes pa de'i las su bya ba rnams phyi gzhag tsam du bya ba ma yin gyi /üîΩci nas kyang dge ba 'am bsod @31a * //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la mi gcod par shes bzhin zhes pa ni bdag gi klog pa dang bsam pa la mi gnod par de'i las gyis shig pa'o // ji dger tshol ba zhes pa de'i las su bya ba rnams phyi gzhag tsam du bya ba ma yin gyi / ci nas kyang dge ba 'am bsod @31a * //
translated: The phrase with a sense of shame and modesty means that you should do his work without interrupting your own work of study and reflection.

original: nams la sogs pa'o snyam du dge ba tshol ba'i 'du shes kyis gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: nams la sogs pa'o snyam du dge ba tshol ba'i 'du shes kyis gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase seeking virtue means that you should do his work with a perception that seeks virtue, thinking, In every way, I will do this work with virtue or merit, etc., and not just do it as a matter of course.

original: mdo dma' bar byed na bzlog ces pa ni gnas de tshul khrims dang lta ba'i mdo zhe na cing dmar byed na de las slar zlog shig pa'o //
analyzed: mdo dma' bar byed na bzlog ces pa ni gnas de tshul khrims dang lta ba'i mdo zhe na cing dmar byed na de las slar zlog shig pa'o //
translated: If he is angry, you should appease him; if he is arrogant, you should humble him; if he is conceited, you should counteract that. The phrase if he is angry, you should appease him means that if he is angry, you should counteract that.

original: dge ba mi 'phel na gzhan de byed pa la gdams par gsol zhes pa ni gnas de'i thad na 'dug na go re long bya bar dengs te dge ba mi 'phel tsam gyi tshod na dge slong gzhan dge ba 'phel bar byed pa la gdams par gsol zhes
analyzed: dge ba mi 'phel na gzhan de byed pa la gdams par gsol zhes pa ni gnas de'i thad na 'dug na go re long bya bar dengs te dge ba mi 'phel tsam gyi tshod na dge slong gzhan dge ba 'phel bar byed pa la gdams par gsol zhes
translated: If you are sitting in that place, go to the refectory and request advice from another monk who is increasing virtue.

original: gsol ba thob shig pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba thob shig pa'o //
translated: Make a request to the extent that virtue is not increasing.üîΩIf you know that the monk who is requesting advice from another monk is suitable to live in that place, then advise him.

original: gnas su 'os par shes na gdams zhes pa ni gnas pa dge slong gzhan gyi thad du gdams par gsol ba'i dge slong de tshul khrims dang ldan zhing gnas su 'os pa zhig yin na de la chol cig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas su 'os par shes na gdams zhes pa ni gnas pa dge slong gzhan gyi thad du gdams par gsol ba'i dge slong de tshul khrims dang ldan zhing gnas su 'os pa zhig yin na de la chol cig pa'o //
translated: If the monk who is requesting advice from another monk is endowed with ethical discipline and is suitable to live in that place, then advise him.

original: gzhan yang gnas kyis gnas pa bcos pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnas kyis gnas pa bcos pa ni /
translated: Furthermore, the resident monk should correct the visitor.

original: sdig pa'i grogs las bzlog ces pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs las bzlog ces pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase turn away from sinful friends and so forth refers to this.

original: dge ba la gzhug ces pa ni dge pa spyod du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba la gzhug ces pa ni dge pa spyod du gzhug pa'o //
translated: The phrase engage in virtue means to engage in virtuous conduct.

original: de bstabs zhes pa ni bdag gis chos bstan pa la sogs pa gnas pa la dge ba stobs shig pa'o /
analyzed: de bstabs zhes pa ni bdag gis chos bstan pa la sogs pa gnas pa la dge ba stobs shig pa'o /
translated: The phrase strengthen that means to strengthen virtue in the resident monk through teaching the Dharma and so forth.

original: ltung ba las dbyung zhing 'tsho ba'i yo byad mthun pa dang ldan bar bshams zhes pa ni gnas pa de la gnas kyis 'di dag bshams shing byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba las dbyung zhing 'tsho ba'i yo byad mthun pa dang ldan bar bshams zhes pa ni gnas pa de la gnas kyis 'di dag bshams shing byin cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase having prepared the provisions for his life and having expelled him from the order means that the community should expel him from the monastery.

original: de la yo byang dang mthun zhes pa ni rgyan po dang mtshon cha bshams pa lta bu ma yin gyi chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa de'i rkyen dang mthun pa shoms shig pa'o //üîΩlhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mkhan po gcig pa dang slob dpon gcig pa dang kun smra ba dang 'dris pa dang 'thad pa rnams kyis nad g-yog bya zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyis byos shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la yo byang dang mthun zhes pa ni rgyan po dang mtshon cha bshams pa lta bu ma yin gyi chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa de'i rkyen dang mthun pa shoms shig pa'o // lhan cig gnas pa dang nye gnas dang mkhan po dang slob dpon dang mkhan po gcig pa dang slob dpon gcig pa dang kun smra ba dang 'dris pa dang 'thad pa rnams kyis nad g-yog bya zhes pa ni 'di rnams kyis byos shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase having prepared the provisions for his life means that the community should provide him with robes, alms-food, bedding, and medicine for the sick.üîΩThe phrase his companions in the holy life, his pupils, his co-pupils, his co-students, his friends, and his relatives should nurse him means that these people should nurse him.

original: de la kun smra zhes pa ni tshig 'jam po la sogs pas bshes pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun smra zhes pa ni tshig 'jam po la sogs pas bshes pa'o //
translated: The phrase his companions in the holy life means those who have the same teacher and the same preceptor.

original: yang dag par smra zhes pa ni yid brtan pa'i tshig smras pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par smra zhes pa ni yid brtan pa'i tshig smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase his friends means those with whom he is intimate.üîΩThe phrase his relatives means those with whom he shares property.

original: 'dris zhes pa ni gnas gcig gam lhan cig tu 'grogs pa la sogs pas 'dis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dris zhes pa ni gnas gcig gam lhan cig tu 'grogs pa la sogs pas 'dis pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is acquainted‚Äù means one who is acquainted through having gone to the same place, having associated with him, and so on.

original: 'thad pa zhes pa ni mthong ba 'am thos pa tsam gyis yin du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'thad pa zhes pa ni mthong ba 'am thos pa tsam gyis yin du 'ong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who is suitable‚Äù means one who might come to be seen or heard.

original: byed pa snga ma med na rim @31b gyis so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i snga ma rnams med na phyi mas nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa snga ma med na rim @31b gyis so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i snga ma rnams med na phyi mas nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the former is not available, the latter should nurse you‚Äù means that if the former mentioned above is not available, the latter should nurse you.

original: klog pa'i slob dpon yang 'dir 'dus so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i nang du klog pa'i slob dpon yang 'dus pas na des kyang nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: klog pa'i slob dpon yang 'dir 'dus so zhes pa ni gong du smos pa'i nang du klog pa'i slob dpon yang 'dus pas na des kyang nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe teacher who instructs you in reading is also included here‚Äù means that the teacher who instructs you in reading is included among those mentioned above, so he too should nurse you.

original: de cig car mi nus na gnas gang la bcas so zhes pa ni bdag gi gnas la sogs pa mang po zhig cig car du na la de kun gyi nad g-yog lag gis mi khyab na bdag gang la zhu ba de'i nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de cig car mi nus na gnas gang la bcas so zhes pa ni bdag gi gnas la sogs pa mang po zhig cig car du na la de kun gyi nad g-yog lag gis mi khyab na bdag gang la zhu ba de'i nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you are unable to do all of them at once, do whichever is available‚Äù means that if you are unable to do all of them at once, such as those who live in your house, and so on, and you are unable to nurse all of them, then do whichever is available.

original: yang na nad tshabs gang che ba'i nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nad tshabs gang che ba'i nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Or else, nurse the one whose illness is more serious.

original: 'dir mtshan ma brtsams na rab tu 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir mtshan ma brtsams na rab tu 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, if one begins a sign, like going forth,

original: 'ga' zhig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma brtsams pa dang nad bla brnyan gyis thebs na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu 'byung ba'i mtshan ma brtsams pa dang nad bla brnyan gyis thebs na /
translated: if one begins a sign that occurs in some places, and is struck by a disease of the head,

original: khyim pa yin du zin gyis kyang rab tu byung ba dang 'dra bas mkhan po la sogs pa god du smos pa rnams kyis nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa yin du zin gyis kyang rab tu byung ba dang 'dra bas mkhan po la sogs pa god du smos pa rnams kyis nad g-yog gyis shig pa'o //
translated: even if one is a householder, it is like going forth, so the preceptor and so forth should say, Take care of the sick!üîΩDo not neglect the sick fellow practitioner of pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nad pa la ma g-yel cig ces pa ni nad pa la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa spyis kyang ma g-yel cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nad pa la ma g-yel cig ces pa ni nad pa la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa spyis kyang ma g-yel cig pa'o //
translated: This means that even the fellow practitioners of pure conduct should not neglect the sick.

original: mi g-yel ba'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: mi g-yel ba'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is the method of not neglecting?

original: de la med na nad g-yog chub par bsgo zhes pa de'i nad g-yog dmigs kyis byed pa med na gcig gnyis dang bca' bcu nas chub kyi bar du ril gyis gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la med na nad g-yog chub par bsgo zhes pa de'i nad g-yog dmigs kyis byed pa med na gcig gnyis dang bca' bcu nas chub kyi bar du ril gyis gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If there is no one for that, fully assign the care of the sick, meaning if there is no one specifically assigned as the care of the sick, then one to ten should fully do it.

original: dge 'dun gyi sman nad pa nyi tshes spyad du rung zhes pa ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi sman spyad du dbang par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sman nad pa nyi tshes spyad du rung zhes pa ni nad pa 'ba' zhig gis dge 'dun gyi sman spyad du dbang par ston pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe medicine of the community is suitable to be used by the patient on the fifteenth day‚Äù indicates that only the patient has the right to use the medicine of the community.

original: de med na g-yog gis btsal zhes pa ni nad pa nyid dam dge 'dun la sman med na nad g-yog gis yon bdag dad pa rnams 'bul du chug cig pa'o //
analyzed: de med na g-yog gis btsal zhes pa ni nad pa nyid dam dge 'dun la sman med na nad g-yog gis yon bdag dad pa rnams 'bul du chug cig pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf that is not available, the attendant should seek it‚Äù means that if the patient himself or the community does not have medicine, the attendant should request that faithful benefactors provide it.

original: ma grub na dge 'dun gyis sbyin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar ma grub na sman zong dge 'dun gyis shugs shig pa'o /
analyzed: ma grub na dge 'dun gyis sbyin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar ma grub na sman zong dge 'dun gyis shugs shig pa'o /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf that is not accomplished, the community should provide it‚Äù means that if the above is not accomplished, the community should provide the medicine.

original: med na sangs rgyas kyi sku la gtogs pa yan chad do zhes pa ni sman nam zong ma rnyed na /
analyzed: med na sangs rgyas kyi sku la gtogs pa yan chad do zhes pa ni sman nam zong ma rnyed na /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf that is not available, it is from the property of the Buddha and so on‚Äù means that if medicine or property is not available,
