analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dkor ram sku'i rgyan yan chad kyang thogs la sman zong gyis shig pa'o //
translated: it should be taken from the property of the Buddha or from the ornaments of the Buddha‚Äôs body.

original: 'di phyir dge 'dun gyi las gdugs tshod gzugs pa dang skom la sogs pa mchod pa bya zhes pa ni nad pa'i bsod nams su dge 'dun gyi @32a * //
analyzed: 'di phyir dge 'dun gyi las gdugs tshod gzugs pa dang skom la sogs pa mchod pa bya zhes pa ni nad pa'i bsod nams su dge 'dun gyi @32a * //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúFor the sake of this and the next world, the community should perform the rite of the midday meal and make offerings of drink and so on‚Äù means that the community should perform the rite of the midday meal and make offerings of drink and so on for the sake of the merit of the patient.

original: dkor las dge 'dun gyi skyems dang / gdugs tshod gzugs pa la sogs pa mchod pa gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dkor las dge 'dun gyi skyems dang / gdugs tshod gzugs pa la sogs pa mchod pa gyis shig pa'o //
translated: From the property of the Sangha, make offerings such as tea for the Sangha and the preparation of meals.

original: med na sangs rgyas kyi las so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar bya /
analyzed: med na sangs rgyas kyi las so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar bya /
translated: If there is none, from the property of the Buddha means as above.

original: dge 'dun la zod med na sangs rgyas kyi dkor las gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la zod med na sangs rgyas kyi dkor las gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If there is no property of the Sangha, from the property of the Buddha means to take from that.

original: ma shi ste yod na gnyi ga las khyer ba de bsab ces pa ni dge 'dun nas sangs rgyas kyi dkor snga shugs su byas pa nad pa des sos shing bdog na slar sobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: ma shi ste yod na gnyi ga las khyer ba de bsab ces pa ni dge 'dun nas sangs rgyas kyi dkor snga shugs su byas pa nad pa des sos shing bdog na slar sobs shig pa'o //
translated: If the patient is not dead, but is well, both means that the patient should repay the debt. From the property of the Sangha and the property of the Buddha means that if the patient recovers and has property, he should repay the debt.

original: mi bdog gam shin spyad du zad do //
analyzed: mi bdog gam shin spyad du zad do //
translated: If he does not have property, it is exhausted means that he is released from the debt.

original: nang g-yog gi las su bya ba ston pa ni /
analyzed: nang g-yog gi las su bya ba ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the duties of the attendant is

original: g-yog gis 'di g-yog mi bya ba ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: g-yog gis 'di g-yog mi bya ba ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The attendant should not not do this and so forth.

original: dge 'dun gyis bskos kyang rung nyid kyis bsnyen mdong du byed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bskos kyang rung nyid kyis bsnyen mdong du byed kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether appointed by the Sangha or taken on by oneself, the attendant means the attendant of the patient.

original: nad g-yog gis g-yog gi bya ba kun gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: nad g-yog gis g-yog gi bya ba kun gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The attendant should do all the duties of an attendant.

original: 'di'i don dang chos kyi ngag mi bcag ces pa ni nad pa des 'tsho ba'i don bya ba dang chos kyi yan lag tu byos shig pa rnams de'i tshig bzhin du sgrubs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i don dang chos kyi ngag mi bcag ces pa ni nad pa des 'tsho ba'i don bya ba dang chos kyi yan lag tu byos shig pa rnams de'i tshig bzhin du sgrubs shig pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that one should practice in accordance with the words of the sick person, ‚ÄúDo not violate the meaning of this, and do not violate the Dharma.‚Äù

original: chags pa'i dngos po slong na mi bkyig ces pa ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa nad pa gang la chags pa de slong na ma bkyig par byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa'i dngos po slong na mi bkyig ces pa ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa nad pa gang la chags pa de slong na ma bkyig par byin cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not withhold when asked for things to which one is attached‚Äù means that if one is asked for the Dharma robes, alms bowl, etc., to which the sick person is attached, do not withhold them, but give them.

original: mi bstan par ma yin zhes pa ni nad g-yog gis nad pa la sman dang bsod na mas kyi yo byad du bstan cing thoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi bstan par ma yin zhes pa ni nad g-yog gis nad pa la sman dang bsod na mas kyi yo byad du bstan cing thoms shig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDo not withhold‚Äù means that the nurse should show the sick person the medicine and the means of nursing, and should not be secretive.

original: nad pas 'di mi mnyan pa ma yin zhes pa ni nad pas nad g-yog gi gdams ngag nyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pas 'di mi mnyan pa ma yin zhes pa ni nad pas nad g-yog gi gdams ngag nyon cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe sick person should not refuse‚Äù means that the sick person should listen to the nurse‚Äôs instructions.

translated: If the vows are conferred while one has the marks of a layperson or a tƒ´rthika, the vows are not generated.üîΩIf the vows are conferred while one is naked, angry, or wearing a turban,üîΩthe vows are not generated.
